intro: Androsace exscapa, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, fleshy, spoon-shaped leaves that are typically covered in a fine layer of white, powdery wax. Its flowers are usually pink or white, with five petals and a distinctive spurred shape. Androsace exscapa thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes.
